column4: can anyone help me figure out why: when this command is run in a S55local file that i add via update-rc.d it doesnt add the drive? /bin/mount -t smbfs -o guest //192.168.0.100/downloads /mnt/wdownloads/
does the command work if you run it from the command line using sudo?
worksfine via sudo but trying to get it to run automatically on boot
if you just want it to work, I suggest adding it to the end of /etc/init.d/bootmisc.sh, since that already runs at boot time
okay ill try thanks one sec
trying its rebooting now
nope adding it there didnt make it show up either
odd
yah running via script via commandline works perfectly
when you run via the command line, does it prompt you for anything?
only the password when i run sudo obviously.....but bootmisc is running as root so no need to run it with sudo right?
hmmm not good if were both stumped :)
I suggest putting some debugging in the bootmisc.sh file
maybe a line "date > /tmp/bootmisc.txt" so you can be sure it ran
cool i will try one second
and maybe redirect output and error of the mount command too:   mount <blah> > /tmp/mount-out.txt 2> /tmp/mount-err.txt
no problem :)
rebooting
oooh good idea: got this back "treeconnect failed: ERRDOS -ERRnoaccess (Access Denied.)
makes no sense since it works fine when were booted properly
bootmisc.sh runs pretty late in the boot sequence
I don't know what that error message means
